item.title: Git
item.description: References Using Git submodules: No matter how less I want to use Git modules, I seem to need them all the time. Most of the time, whenever I use a program like Hugo which has external extensions, I end up needing submodules. Common procedures Remove a Submodule within git: Adding a submodule is easy, removing is such a pain

item.title: Golang
item.description: Best practices Gophers, please tag your releases (Dave Cheney) - Tag your releases in preparation for better dependency tools coming in the future (2016-06-24) Idiomatic Go tricks - By Mat Ryer, companion blog post (Youtube, 2016-09-09) Important third party libraries GORM: A popular Go ORM. Very well written usage documentation. CLI (Command line libraries): urfave CLI: Formerly codegangsta/cli. Man page like extensive help formatting. Cobra: Integrates with Viper, a config management library Implementation articles Error handling in Upspin: An interesting article by the legendary Rob Pike about how to use custom error types to provide more meaningful messages in an app with many components.

item.title: Welcome
item.description: This is just a collection of my references on various topics. Current docs include: Golang Git
